Research on autonomous navigation of Unmanned Aerial Vehicle (UAV) plays a pivotal role in designing reliable industrial UAVs for diverse applications.

An interesting application for this technology is the capability of navigating under tree canopies. Such drones will be extremely valuable for security and data collection in farms or plantations.

Hence, we propose a Deep Reinforcement Learning (DRL) aided approach that enables the proposed UAV to execute navigation tasks under tree canopies.

The mission is formulated by exploiting the Partially Observable Markov Decision Process (POMDP) and solved by a novel DRL algorithm.
